ygData.subject: RE: Level 39 song should be.....
ygData.msgSnippet: Madagan, Unrest and Befallen are unusual and apparently special cases.  Probably due to their level range as you mentioned, the undead in those locations have
ygData.messageBody:
Madagan,

Unrest and Befallen are unusual and apparently special cases. Probably due
to their level range as you mentioned, the undead in those locations have
been "nerfed" (I'm sure they write flaming alt.games.everquest posts about
it too) - they can't see normally invised folks. If you go to the undead
side of Lower Guk, Kithicor Forest at night, or use Clouding against
Spectres, etc. you will find that it is inneffective. It's *not* truly
invis to undead even though the issue is clouded (no pun intended) by bards
having matured using it in places like Unrest and Befallen. When I visit
Unrest or Befallen I still fire up Clouding, but make no mistake - this
won't work in Lower Guk or Kithicor.

Crier

> From: firehawk@...
>
> I hate to say this but Invis to undead is pointless. Sonorious
> Clouding -IS- invisibility to live or Undead with modification to
> level. I have at level 22 walked completely unmolested though
> Unrest mansion with it active. As soon as I dropped it I was
> attacked. I have walked through befallen with the same results.
> I have no doubt that our clouding is a universal invisability and
> was intended as one, there for we do not need invis vs undead. I
> think the problem is that many of you who have had troubles with
> this either had bad parties that broke the invis (wandered out of
> range, attacked, cast looted) at which point you also become
> visiable, or are trying to hide from undead levels much higher
> then you where it I guess resisted the song. I personally would
> like to see a true mem blur song.. except GZ and crew are more
> worried about enchanters and balancing us to be lesser the ever
> present curse of jack of all trades master of none motief, then
> the actual usefulness of bards.
